document.docAuthor: Gobbi, Fernanda T. & Azevedo, Celso O.
document.docTitle: Caloapenesia paruwa Gobbi & Azevedo, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Caloapenesia (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of sixteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Caloapenesia (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of sixteen new species

heading.emphasis:
Caloapenesia paruwa Gobbi & Azevedo
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. MALE. Body length 6.4 mm . LFW 4.2 mm . Color . Head, clypeus and mesosoma black; mandible, antennae and metasoma dark castaneous; legs castaneous; wings slightly brownish.

Head (
Fig. 13
). Mandible with five apical teeth; uppermost one blunt, others angulate; large, subequal in length. Median clypeal lobe convex; apical margin strongly medially ventrad, without median tooth conspicuous; carina high, arched in profile. Antennal torulus slightly prominent. Flagellomeres median-sized; four first antennomeres in ratio about 20 : 4 : 7 : 7 ; pedicel short, 1.0 × as long as wide; flagellomere I 1.42 × as long as wide; flagellomere IX 1.25 × as long as wide; flagellar pubescence suberect and erect, about half of diameter of flagellomeres. Frons polished; densely punctate. WH 0.92 × LH. WF 0.80 × WH. WF 1.93 × HE. Eye small, salient; pilosity sparse. Ocellus small.
DAO
0.13 × WF; frontal angle of ocellar triangle acute. WOT 3.0 ×
DAO
. OOL 1.0 × WOT. Distance of posterior ocellus to vertex crest 3.0 ×
DAO
. VOL 1.0 × HE. Temple slightly divergent. Vertex straight. Occipital carina complete, visible in dorsal view; ventral projection on occipital carina present.

Distribution. Thailand (Chaiyaphum, Chanthaburi, Chiang Mai, Kamphaeng Phet, Loei, Nakhon Nayok, Phitsanulok, Suphanburi).

Variation . Median clypeal lobe with median tooth slightly conspicuous; median carina of clypeus straight in profile; ventral projection of occipital carina incosnpicuous; notaulus incomplete; basal triangle of propodeum strongly delimited, with carina paramedian conspicuous. The specimens from Loei are smaller than another. The specimen from Chayaphum has ocelli smaller than another specimen.

Remarks .
C. paruwa
sp. nov.
resembles
C. nadaili
sp. nov.
by presents head elongate; ocellus and eye small; aedeagus uniformly wide; hypopygium slightly trilobate. But
C. paruwa
sp. nov.
presents head with aspect quadrangular; uppermost tooth of mandible blunt; ventral projection of occipital carina; fovea of mesopleuron shallow.
